Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2009 03:13PM dmh2418 wrote: I had 33 rads, 28 reg and 5 boosts.  I took a 10 break for vacation about mid-way through but still was tired.  It wasn't until I was done that I really felt fatigued.  Then I figured it out and the tamox was causing the fatigue.  Once I stopped the tamox I felt better in two weeks.
Posts.Title: RADIATION FATIGUE - POLL bluejay1 Siciliana

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2009 06:37PM dmh2418 wrote: I loved my sports bra but bought one just a little bigger and it was so comfortable.  I also put a gauze pad on my incision and the bra.  I learned the hard way what happens when you don't.  OUCH!
Posts.Title: what type of a bra did you wear after your lumpectomy? aris Hopeful82014

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2009 08:16PM dmh2418 wrote: I have been trying to find any reseach related to bc and autoimmune diseases and can't find any.  I have lupus and bc and it is causing problems with the meds and se's.  My rheumatologist, a med school student and a nurse have been trying to find any informaiton as well but there's nothing to find.  My rheumatologist said that only .8% of women have lupus so the odds of them also developing bc are going to be rare.  Unfortunately, I live in an area with a very high rate of cancer, lupus and ms and if we don't have much I don't know who would.  I'm going to our cancer center in two weeks to see if they have any answers.
Posts.Title: Immune system problems and cancer related? ailenroc orange1

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2008 10:10AM dmh2418 wrote: It's amazing sometimes what the body does.  I now have a mamogram and sonogram each year.  My bc didn't show up on the sonogram but did on the mamo.  My gyn told me not to bother following up and thank goodness I didn't listen to them.  My aunt is stage 4 and her's didn't show up on her mamo either.  She found it by accident when she went for x-rays when her hip was bothering her.  Turns out the cancer had already spread to her bones.
Posts.Title: Am I the Only One Who Didn't Know???? shockedat39 whoopsiedoodles

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2009 08:57PM dmh2418 wrote: I started getting bad pain in my breast that had the lumpectomy too.  After I stopped taking the Tamoxifen it went away.  My onc answer was that this will be something like arthritis, the pain will come and go.  Well, she is no longer my onc and can go anywhere but near me.  I am waiting to go to another onc to see if I should stay off the Tamo or not.
Posts.Title: Bad pain 2 months after lumpectomy. chapuzan Roberta77

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2009 01:35AM dmh2418 wrote: I had half a mm too and had the rads.  It wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. My rad onc was wonderul and the office was only 5 minutes away from my home and could go on my way to work. I did take a 10 day break for vacation and I really think that helped physically and mentally.
Posts.Title: 2 mm clear margins - how bad it is? tiptop dmh2418

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2008 12:02AM dmh2418 wrote: I'm having joint pain and fatigue which is really bad.  I also have lupus so I don't know which is which anymore.  I want to stop the tamox even if its for a month or two to "catch my breath" and give my body a break.  I've been on since July.
Posts.Title: joint stiffness Denise61 Denise61

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2009 07:07PM dmh2418 wrote: I finished my 33 rads in October and did have some fatigue even though the nurse kept telling me that wasn't a se of rad.  She said that the daily trip to and from the office is what makes people more fatigued.  I wasn't supposed to have rads because I also have lupus and it could have caused a flare.  I continued to work full time and maintain my household activities but not as much as I was used to.  My rad onc also let me take a 10 vacation so it broke up the treatments and gave my body a rest.  I only had a little rad rash in the upper,inner quad of my breast but vasoline lotion took care of that (I tried everything else and my nurse recommend vasoline).  It wasn't until the boosters that I got a little "sunburn" on my breast but it wasn't that bad.  Just remember to give yourself some "me" time during all this and listen to your body.
Posts.Title: side effects of radiation therapy Maria217 Imasurvivor
